Ich habe mittlerweile knapp 450h Spielzeit in diesem Spiel und ich muss sagen, dass ich es sehr schwierig finde mich zu entscheiden, ob ich das Game weiterempfehle oder nicht. 
Wenn es einem alleine um den Spielspa√ü oder das taktische Zusammenstellen der besten F√§higkeiten geht, ist das Spiel zu empfehlen. Allerdings braucht man schon so einige Spielstunden, bis man wirklich loslegen kann.

Ich spiele haupts√§chlich Surviver. Das bedeutet, dass meine Aufgaben es sind, meinen 3 Teamkollegen zu helfen, Generatoren fertigzustellen und die Ausgangstore aufzumachen. Au√üerdem und das ist die Hauptaufgabe: Ich muss mich vor dem Killer verstecken w√§hrend ich das alles mache. Viele Surviver-Spieler regen sich auf, dass sie nicht gegen den Killer ankommen. Das ist aber nicht die Aufgabe eines Survivers. Es ist eher wie ein Hide'n'Seek-Spiel. Daher muss der Surviver sich m√∂glichst gut tarnen und verstecken k√∂nnen. Und nach etwa 100 Spielstunden ist die Mechanik so vertraut und die Maps alle soweit bekannt, dass man gerne auch mal den Killer w√§hrend einer Verfolgungsjagd auf Abstand h√§lt.

Aber nat√ºrlich spiele ich ab und zu auch als Killer. Ist eine sch√∂ne Abwechslung als Main-Surviver, daher definitiv zu empfehlen. Als Killer kannst du deutlich schneller an Blutpunkte kommen (die man zum Aufleveln ben√∂tigt). Das ist der Hauptvorteil. Aber nicht jeder Killer spielt sich gleich gut, deswegen lasst euch nicht von dem Schwierigkeitsgrad t√§uschen der dransteht. Ein Beispiel: Fallensteller, Geist und Hinterw√§ldler sind "einfache" Charakt√§re, allerdings kann ich mit ihnen √ºberhaupt nicht umgehen. Ich spiele lieber die Krankenschwester oder den Doktor (Doktor zb. ist als "schwer" eingestuft). 

Ein ganz gro√üer Vorteil an diesem Spiel ist, dass die DLCs (die mittlerweile schon einen enormen Wert des Games ausmachen) nicht zum Spielen notwendig sind. Im Gegenteil. Ihr bekommt durch DLCs nur neue Charaktere und Karten als Auswahlm√∂glichkeit geschenkt. Jedoch k√∂nnt ihr deren einzigartige F√§higkeiten sowie die neue Map ebenfalls miterleben. Die Maps werden ALLE random ausgew√§hlt, also auch die, die man vielleicht nicht selber besitzt. Und mit der Mechanik des Schreins, haben die Devs gute Arbeit geleistet, dass man auch F√§higkeiten von DLC-Charakteren freischalten kann, ohne das DLC zu nutzen. 

Ich habe jetzt auch in der Public Beta den neuen Shop ausprobiert und bin sehr begeistert davon. Im Shop lassen sich Charaktere mit "Aurazellen" also RL-Geld kaufen, was allerdings nur einen kleinen Teil des Shops ausmacht. Ihr k√∂nnt zu den nicht lizensierten Charakteren (also Charakteren, die von den DbD-Devs selber entwickelt wurden) sogar Kleidungsst√ºcke kaufen, was das ganze noch interessanter macht.

Mit der richtigen Zeitinvestition ist das Game echt super. Es ist KEIN Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch.

Dead By Daylight!

Such a fun game to play alone and even more fun with friends.
It gives you the chills as if you are in the game but guess what? If you manage to save other people, fix generators and exit - you will feel so satisfied that you want to keep continuing playing the game! 

Positives:
- You can play it alone when you are bored and are in the mood for it
- You can play it with your friends and family if they own the game as well!
- You can get outfits and I believe that more will be coming soon too which look pretty good.
- You can level up different characters, play them and pick your best character and teach perks to the character you are comfortable with the most.
- IT'S SO FUN THAT YOU SHOULD BUY THE GAME AND TRY IT!

Negatives:
- If the killer is new, he will camp the shit out of you. In other words, say you spawn after waiting for the game to load, the killer spawns next to you and catches you, he'd hook you and stare into your soul that you would rather die than struggling.
- It takes forever to level up the characters in my opinion unless you farm points or are awesome that you can dodge the killer everytime, fix generators and get the hell out of there!

Overall, it's an awesome game and you need to get it if you still haven't! I would rate it a 9.5/10 (EFF YOU CAMPERS!!)
Excellent jeu si vous aimez tuer ou survivre . je vous conseille de jouer a plusieurs

+ Super Neuinterpretation des beliebten Kinderspiels "R√§uber und Gendarm". Verspricht viele Spielstunden voller Spa√ü und Angst f√ºr einen wirklich angemessenen Preis :)

- Leider tauchen immer wieder Bugs auf die das Spielgestehen mehr oder weniger beeintr√§chtigen k√∂nnen (die Entwickler versuchen jedoch regelm√§√üig durch Patches/Fixes dem entgegenzutreten)

Is this game rough around the edges? - Yes
Does it take some time to get in to properly? - Kinda

Then why do I recommend it? This is one of the most original games I've ever played. A seriously tense game of cat and mouse between four survivors, who can opt to work as a team but ultimately are in it for themselves, versus a killer who is out to terrify and kill all four survivors. The genius bit comes into when you are scored (The bloodpoint system). Rather than killing all four survivors as quickly as possible... you're encouraged to make it dramatic. As a killer you can easily just slash a survivor, place him on a hook (which is required to kill him) and just watch him die so noone can come to save him, but that doesn't score you well. Instead, look towards playing with your food and making sure they are tense. It'll work out better, trust me.

As I say, if you want to be a killer, try them all and find which one you enjoy most... get into the concept of making yourself a true menace to the survivors without just killing them as fast as possible. If you want to be a survivor, work with people but be sure to keep yourself alive for the mostpart. Make sure generators are getting repaired to escape but always make sure you are safe in the meantime, and if escape is an option but a friend is on a hook, weigh up the option... there isn't always a definitive answer...

And whatever you do, don't let Michael just stare at you.

michael myers (le nouveau chasseur) vous voit quoi qu'il arrive. Il cours plus vite que les survivants, les one-shot, on ne le voit m√™me plus arriv√©, une musique qui explose les oreilles bref une vrai compilation pour vous faire rager et Alt+F4 le jeu en deux secondes.
Pour finir je le recommande mais seulement si les dev nerf le perso car c'est vraiment du n'importe quoi 0% Fun.

Was mich st√∂rt ist das das DLC kostet und ein OP Killer kommt. Erinnert mich an den Anfang von LoL......

After 2 years this game is still bad. Your character doesn't have a weapon and all you basically do is just run around finding generators to fix. It's basically a chore but you get killed for it and the killer will camp at you for the rest of their life until you're dead. Bad game, avoid.
The new killer has very unique to all previous ones and seem to learn more to fight with it and it may take time. But it's still difficult to handle it right now.

Are there bugs? Yes.
Are the Devs a lil heavy-handed when it comes to fixed? Sometimes.
Can you hide in a locker with bated breath as a knife-wielding psycho stalks past? You betcha!

Overall; enjoyable even if a tad grindy.

10/10 would step in own bear-trap while picking up a Dwight again.

Well, after trying to contact Behaviour three times, and EAC twice, and getting no answers, here I am.

It was one day like any other. I was trying to play with my friends but the invitations didn't let me inside. It was odd, so I restarted the game. When that didn't work, I restarted the PC, and nothing. I was invited, tried to accept, and nothing. No pop-up saying "I have no internet" like many other times, no "Couldn't find the room"... Nothing at all. Then tried to queue as survivor alone, and found a game. Left and tried to join, and nothing. Tried to queue as Killer and the lobby was instantly full. I was so obsessed trying to fix the "friends bug" that I kept trying to fix it instead of actually playing the game.
After hours trying, I went to sleep. Seven hours later, when I open Steam, a window finally does pop-up. "Dead by Daylight has permanently blocked you on Easy Anti Cheat, in the game developer's name" (sort of. I'm not native english, and the window was in spanish, but more or less, the translation is accurate).

I won't lie: I was raging. Didn't even need my daily coffe to wake up after that window. To be honest, I didn't even try to open the game to see if it was an error or not, I just uninstalled instantly. Then, when I was more calmed, I wrote a ticket to BHVR to ask why. I didn't even appeal for it to be removed, I just wanted an answer. I have the emails still saved, but I'm not sure if it will fit in the review, so more or less, they were washing their hands and sent me to contact EAC. I felt they were dispatching me, but I didn't care to be honest. I just wanted my answer and sent the same ticket to EAC. Here's a quote of what they ansered me: "There is substantial evidence that account 76561198044081381 violated Dead by Daylight End User Licence Agreement. Using cheats, modifying parts of the game that Behaviour Interactive does not specifically authorize the players to modify, and other actions can cause a violation of the game's EULA. Please refer to Section 1 "Rules of Conduct" for more information: (link to the said EULA)"

Okay, I get it. They have "substantial evidence", yet I didn't cheat even once. And I still got no answer. And before I forget it, in the email they also said that they won't tell me more because it would only help their developers (cheat developers). 

I couldn't believe it. I saw, like most of you, many MANY people banned in this game. Toxic ones, exploiters, actual cheaters... They all got a warning/temp-ban, then a permaban. Some of them did even came back and got (then yeah) instantly permabanned. I didn't even get a warning of my "substantial evident" cheats. Just got permanently banned and I don't know the reason.

I tried to contact BHVR again, told them what happened with EAC, and the answer was more or less the same one, but with a "We're sorry, but...". 
I still have an open ticket to EAC, and I have MY "substantial evidence" that they're ignoring it, so here I am. Telling you my story and why a game where I spent like 100‚Ç¨ and 600hours will stay in my library forever uninstaled now.
